comment.text: This translation key is used to display the string "in the left panel" in a checkbox label within the Portal Settings page, specifically under the "Developer Tools" preset. It appears alongside checkboxes for other options and provides context about the checkbox's purpose.

usage.context:
onChange={() => {}}
 isChecked
 />
 <RowContainer>
 <Checkbox label={t("Chat")} onChange={() => {}} isChecked />
 <Text color="gray">({t("InLeftPanel")})</Text>
 </RowContainer>
 <RowContainer>
 <Checkbox label={t("FeedbackAndSupport")} onChange={() => {}} isChecked />
 <Text color="gray">({t("InLeftPanel")})</Text>
 </RowContainer>

ai_spell_check_issues.description: While "左パネルで" (hidari paneru de) is technically a valid translation, it lacks the nuance and flow of the original English phrase "in the left panel". It reads more like "with the left panel" or "in/at the left panel doing something". A more accurate translation that conveys the meaning of location would be preferable.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: 左パネル内 (hidari paneru nai) - inside the left panel, or 左パネルに (hidari paneru ni) - in the left panel.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: While 'ທາງຊ້າຍມື' literally translates to 'left hand side', it doesn't convey the same meaning as 'in the left panel'. 'In the left panel' refers to a specific area within a user interface. A more accurate translation would depend on the context of the panel, but something like 'ໃນແຜນວົງຊ້າຍ' (in the left panel) would be closer.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider 'ໃນແຜນວົງຊ້າຍ' or a more contextually appropriate translation depending on the user interface.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation 'වම්පස මඬලෙහි' while technically correct, might not be the most natural or common phrasing for 'in the left panel' in a software UI context. 'මඬලෙහි' refers to a stage or pavilion, which might not be the most appropriate word for a panel in a software interface. A more user-friendly and common phrasing might be better.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider alternatives like 'මිට වම්පස' (mita vampasa) or 'වාම් පැත්ත' (vaam pettya) for a more natural feel in a UI context.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Serbian translation 'у левом панелу' uses the preposition 'у' which typically indicates location 'in' but the dative case ending '-у' implies possession or a relationship.  For describing location, the preposition 'на' followed by the dative case would be more appropriate.
